solution_line_template: Tank's total number of eggs in the second round was {emma_second_round_eggs}/2=<<{emma_second_round_eggs}/2={tank_second_round_eggs}>>{tank_second_round_eggs} since Emma gathered twice as many eggs as Tank in their second round of egg hunt.

The total number of eggs that Emma and Tank gathered in the second round was {emma_second_round_eggs}+{tank_second_round_eggs}=<<{emma_second_round_eggs}+{tank_second_round_eggs}={emma_and_tank_second_round_eggs}>>{emma_and_tank_second_round_eggs}

Tank's total number of eggs in the second round was {tank_second_round_less} less than the number she had gathered in the first round, meaning she had gathered {tank_second_round_eggs}+{tank_second_round_less}=<<{tank_second_round_eggs}+{tank_second_round_less}={tank_first_round_eggs}>>{tank_first_round_eggs} eggs in the first round of egg hunt.
Tank gathered {tank_first_round_more} more Easter eggs than Emma in their first round of egg hunt, meaning Emma collected {tank_first_round_eggs}-{tank_first_round_more}=40 eggs

The total number of eggs Emma and Tank collected in the first round was {emma_first_round_eggs}+{tank_first_round_eggs}=<<{emma_first_round_eggs}+{tank_first_round_eggs}={emma_and_tank_first_round_eggs}>>{emma_and_tank_first_round_eggs}

In the two rounds, Emma and Tank gathered {emma_and_tank_first_round_eggs}+{emma_and_tank_second_round_eggs}=<<{emma_and_tank_first_round_eggs}+{emma_and_tank_second_round_eggs}={total_emma_and_tank_eggs}>>{total_emma_and_tank_eggs} eggs

If the total number of eggs in the pile they were collecting with 6 other people was {total_eggs} eggs, the six other people gathered {total_eggs}-{total_emma_and_tank_eggs}=<<{total_eggs}-{total_emma_and_tank_eggs}={other_hunters_eggs}>>{other_hunters_eggs} eggs
